meanings.definition: A long, narrative poem celebrating the achievements of a hero.
meanings.sent1: The library had a collection of ancient epopees about brave warriors.
meanings.sent2: In literature class, we studied the epopees of ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent3: The children acted out their own epopees, pretending to be legendary heroes.
meanings.sent4: Her journey to success was like an epic epopee, filled with challenges and victories.
meanings.sent5: The epopees painted vivid pictures of heroic adventures in the minds of the readers.

meanings.sent1: The epopees of old were passed down through generations.
meanings.sent2: Scholars dedicated their lives to studying the epopees of different cultures.
meanings.sent3: The bookstore had a special section just for epopees, showcasing the richness of storytelling.
meanings.sent4: The epopees lined the shelves, each one a masterpiece of ancient literature.
meanings.sent5: The epopees captured the essence of heroism and adventure in poetic form.

meanings.sent1: The students analyzed the structure of epopees in their poetry class.
meanings.sent2: The bard recited the epopees with passion, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent3: The epopees were like windows to the past, revealing tales of valor and honor.
meanings.sent4: Her words flowed like a river of epopees, enchanting all who listened.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of epopees lies in their ability to transport us to distant lands and times.
